Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst Opportunity

Salary: £30k–£40k Per Annum




Launch Your Career as a Data Analyst!

Are you ready to embark on an exciting journey as a Data Analyst?

We’ve partnered with forward-thinking companies looking for skilled Data Analysts to join their teams. And here’s the best part: no prior experience is required to start your career!




How Does It Work?

At Fortray, we provide comprehensive training designed to equip you with cutting-edge data analysis skills. Through live online sessions led by experienced industry professionals, our program offers hands-on expertise to help you thrive in this dynamic field.

Our flexible training program is tailored for everyone—whether you’re a student, a working professional, or considering a career change. With a schedule designed to suit your commitments, a rewarding career in data analytics is within your reach.




Are You Passionate About Data-Driven Insights?

We’re looking for individuals who excel at analyzing and interpreting data to drive informed decisions and enhance operational efficiency. As a Data Analyst, you’ll play a pivotal role in transforming raw data into actionable insights that shape business strategies.




Key Responsibilities

Data Collection: Gather and validate data from various sources, ensuring accuracy and completeness.
Data Preparation: Clean and preprocess datasets to resolve inconsistencies and prepare them for analysis.
Statistical Analysis: Apply statistical techniques to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA): Analyze data characteristics and derive key insights.
Visualization: Develop compelling reports, dashboards, and visualizations using tools like Excel, Tableau, or Power BI.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Present findings clearly to stakeholders to support data-driven decision-making.
Cross-Functional Support: Partner with teams across departments to address their data needs and provide analytical solutions.
Database Management: Maintain and update databases to ensure integrity and accessibility.
Query Optimization: Enhance SQL queries for efficient data retrieval and analysis.
Performance Monitoring: Track and evaluate Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to drive business performance.
Documentation: Create detailed documentation of methodologies and findings for clarity and reproducibility.




Skills & Experience

Proficiency in tools like Excel, SQL, Python, R, Tableau, or Power BI.
Strong understanding of statistical methods, data modeling, and analytical problem-solving.
Exceptional attention to detail to ensure data accuracy and address discrepancies.
Excellent communication skills to effectively present insights to stakeholders.




Start Your Data Analytics Career Today!

If you’re passionate about turning data into actionable insights and ready to kick-start a thriving career, we want to hear from you!

Submit your application and resume now and let Fortray guide you through expert training and certification. Together, we’ll help you make a lasting impact as a Data Analyst!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst- Geocoding, Opendata, exploratory data analysis, NLP




Want to Help Revolutionise Last-Mile Logistics with Precision and Efficiency?




Interested? Join the Data Analytics Team!




We've partnered with a leading german startup who provide a geo-based and AI powered product to help transform the last mile logistics industry. Imagine building a product which is used by industry leaders such as AWS and google.




Were looking for Data analysts who have experience in :




processing geocode requests and working in an open source proprietary data platform.
Experienced in either ( Python, Node, Kotlin, Java, Node Js).
Experienced in working with Geospatial data projects.




On top of this if you are interested in working in an environment which prioritises Machine learning and NLP then this role will be for you!

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Willkommen bei CBTW! Wir sind ein innovatives Team mit über 3.000 Mitarbeitern in 21 Ländern und führend in den Bereichen Strategie & Governance, Software-Engineering, Datenanalyse & KI und mehr.

Als Mitglied unseres Teams bei CBTW arbeitest Du in einem inspirierenden Umfeld an anspruchsvollen Projekten. Wir fördern die Entwicklung der Experten von morgen und schätzen Deine Ideen. Wenn Du bereit bist, die Zukunft der datengetriebenen Transformation mit einem hochmotivierten Team zu gestalten, bewirb Dich jetzt bei CBTW! Zusammen schaffen wir Großartiges.

Aufgaben

Deine Leidenschaft


Analyse fachlicher Anforderungen und Ableitungen analytischer Zielsetzungen für Kund:innen
Zusammenhänge komplexer Geschäftsdaten erzeugen und diese in performanten Reports visualisieren
Self-Service Datenanalysen gestalten sowie die Datenvorverarbeitung
Konsolidierung von Daten zur Ableitung angemessener Handlungsempfehlungen



Dieses Wissen bietet unseren Kund:innen echten Mehrwert. Du bist das Bindeglied zwischen IT und Business. Du konzipierst. Du realisierst. Du treibst voran.

Qualifikation

Dein Talent


Deutsch-Kenntnisse auf C1 Niveau - Beherrschung der Sprache (German Fluency is a must)
Masterabschluss, vorzugsweise in (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen oder einer vergleichbaren Studienrichtung
Ca. 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Data Analytics
Technologieerfahrung: Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, Cognos BI, Tools wie Alteryx oder Yellowfin
Erfahrung in R Shiny, KNIME oder Visual Analytics ist von Vorteil
Reisebereitschaft innerhalb der DACH Region



Es ist unwahrscheinlich, dass jede:r Kandidat:in all diese Anforderungen erfüllt. Wenn Deine Erfahrungen anders sind und Du glaubst, dass Du einen Mehrwert für die Position bieten kannst, lass uns gerne darüber sprechen!

Benefits

Unser Versprechen

Wir bieten Dir eine Kultur, die von unseren Führungsleitsätzen angetrieben wird: unternehmerisch, ergebnisorientiert, Eigenverantwortung fördernd und sich gegenseitig zum Erfolg verhelfend. Wir schaffen Transparenz über Unternehmensziele, Zusammenarbeit und Unterstützung durch ein internationales Team auf Augenhöhe. Wir leben Austausch, Teamgeist und einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. Das verbindet uns hierarchieübergreifend – auch im Home-Office. So erhielten wir in 2022, 2023 und 2024 die kununu Auszeichnung „TOP Company“.

Das erwartet Dich bei uns:


Onboarding: Vernetzung ab dem ersten Tag - Welcome Day, Hello Drink, Mentoring-Programm.
Entwicklung: Individuelle Förderung Deiner Stärken - Regelmäßige Feedbackgespräche, Karrierepfade, Career Committees, Online-Trainingskatalog, internationales Arbeiten mit verschiedenen Kulturen.
Work-Life-Balance: Raum für Deine Lebensplanung - Sabbatical, Remote Working aus dem Ausland, flexible Arbeitsmodelle, Elternzeitprogramme, 30 Tage Urlaub, Feiertagskalender Baden-Württemberg.
Nachhaltigkeit: Unsere Arbeit hat einen positiven Einfluss auf die Umwelt und die Gesellschaft - wir machen unsere Lösungen und Zusammenarbeit jeden Tag nachhaltiger.
Events: Fachliche und unterhaltsame Events - Summer-Tech-Event, lokale Afterworks, Sportevents, Teamevents, Weihnachtsfeiern.
Netzwerken: Verbinde Dich mit internationalen Kolleg:innen - Communities, Lunch Breaks, interne Know-How Sessions.
Fehlerkultur: Teste Dich aus und lerne aus Fehlern - Wir geben Dir Freiraum, mit neuesten Technologien zu arbeiten.
Prämien: Zahlreiche Prämien für zusätzliches Engagement.
Weitere Vorteile: Digitales Mobilitätsbudget, Corporate Benefits, Jobfahrrad, Deutschlandticket, betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement.



Schau Dir unsere CBTW Spotify Playlist an und erhalte einen ersten musikalischen Eindruck von unserem Team: https://open.spotify.com/playlist/44kgWZRt5jmmgppH0qGszg?si=L312ch\_9SMKsCKBcN-EB\_A

Aber genug von uns, jetzt bist Du an der Reihe - Wir freuen uns darauf, Dich kennenzulernen!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst, Paid Search
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

Innovative and effective Performance Marketing is the driving force of our success. We take a data-driven approach to connect the customer's intent to the right inventory in our marketplace. We believe in building scalable channels, by working in cross-functional teams (Product, Engineering, Data Science, Content, Design) to build the best marketing automation in the industry. We are looking for an outstanding Data Analyst - Paid Search to join our Berlin HQ. Be a part of one of Berlin's most innovative and cutting-edge Performance Marketing teams and gain exposure to a large scale, highly automated marketing engine.

You Will


Support data-driven decision-making around steering and bidding.
Regularly monitor and analyze the performance of our paid search campaigns, focusing on profitability and growth to identify opportunities for optimisation.
Analyze trends, including seasonality and market-specific behaviors, to identify and remove inefficiencies in our spent allocation.
Collaborate with the team to design and execute A/B tests to measure the impact of new bidding strategies and tactics. Analyze test results and translate them into actionable insights.
Work closely with Data Science and other Business Units on topics such as bids elasticity, CLV, and revenue maturation modeling.


Who You Are


You bring 3-5 years of experience interpreting data in Marketing Analytics, Business Intelligence or a related field.
Prior exposure to Paid Search, Bidding, and Marketing KPIs is a strong plus.
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis.
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks).
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers.
You are an excellent communicator who can present complex data findings to cross-functional teams in fluent English.
You want to work in a fast-paced environment, balance multiple priorities and use your own initiative.


How We Set You Up For Success


Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget
Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal-opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Important notice: Protect yourself from recruitment scams

We want to ensure your safety during the application process. Please be aware of potential scammers impersonating GetYourGuide recruiters. Remember, GetYourGuide never requests payment or sensitive personal information during recruitment. All official job opportunities are exclusively posted on our Careers page. If you suspect fraudulent activity, report it to jobs@getyourguide.com. Stay vigilant and protect yourself from recruitment scams.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (all genders) Full Time, Berlin
Description:
Here at BARFER’S we love pets and want to revolutionize the pet food market.

With a selection of over 280 premium products developed and produced in-house in Berlin, we are already setting new standards to promote the health and well-being in the pet care market. Whether through our online shop or one of our eight stores in Berlin, Potsdam, and Hamburg, we make BARF accessible to everyone who wants the very best for their animals. BARF stands for biologically appropriate raw food and has been around since 1993.

This vision drives our team of more than 100 employees every single day. Together, we are making a lasting impact on the pet care industry – and we’re continuing to grow.

Join our pack and help us actively shape the future of the pet care market!

Here at BARFERs we want to build the e-commerce organization of the future, where data drives all our decision-making. To drive this vision you will design processes, define KPIs, build dashboards, and design predictive models to inform business and product decisions. In this role, you drive data solutions at scale by being the primary partner to our Commercial, Marketing and IT Teams.

Using your technical skills, business acumen, and creativity, you will build automated data solutions that provide tactical and strategic insights. As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will combine technology and innovation to organize data, enable insights and create the world’s most data-driven and efficient organization. You will lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects using your analytics, visualization, and data warehousing expertise, manage project schedules, identifying risks, and communicating them with clarity to project stakeholders. You're equally versed at explaining your team's analyses to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.

Aufgaben


Partner closely with the Marketing and Commercial teams, understand their data needs, and address those with intelligent data solutions in a timely, scalable and sustainable fashion.
Partner with our Data Engineering and Technical BI teams to enhance data infrastructure, data availability, and broad access to commercial and financial insights made available through self-service Power BI/Looker dashboards.
Solve complex business problems through understandable statistical solutions, enabling the business to make better decisions and complete their responsibilities more efficiently.
Work closely with each department head to conduct business and financial analysis, including pricing, forecasting and monitoring of key business activity.
Identify data points and proactively develop new metrics and analysis.
Implement Machine Learning and Predictive Modeling algorithms to support automated forecasting.



Qualifikation


E-commerce experience is a must.
Experience working in a high-paced environment.
Open, entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to build trust and partnerships easily.
You like to work in ambiguous environments and are not afraid to try and learn.
You are a self-starter that takes ownership: You always help, no matter your job description.
You are hands-on and always keep the long-term goals as a priority.
You have a degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Finance and/or other quantitative fields.
3+ years of experience in Analytics or Business Intelligence, performing quantitative analysis in a commercial context.
You’re skilled at querying and building databases (SQL, Big Query) and have proven experience building data visualizations with e.g.: Power BI, Power Pivot or Looker.
You have gained first experience with Python or other relevant scripting languages.
You can explain technical concepts and analysis implications clearly to a wide audience, including senior executives, and be able to translate business objectives into actionable analyses.
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills are preferred.



Benefits


Competitive compensation package depending on your experience.
30 days of vacation per year – plus an extra day off on your birthday, just for you!
An exciting opportunity to join a well-funded and fast-growing German e-commerce start-up, where you can help build and shape the company from the ground up!
Fast-moving, ambitious & entrepreneurial culture, strong career development, and growth opportunities.
We’re dog-friendly! Bring your dog along to work.



Sounds exciting?

Apply now! We can’t wait to get to know you!

At BARFERs we value a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we believe it is the key to innovation and happy employees. BARFERs is committed to providing an open, friendly, safe, and welcoming environment for every employee. We are delighted to receive applications from diverse candidates including gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, and religious beliefs

BARFERs does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our job’s alias, BARFERs employees or any other organization location. BARFERs will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
Show more

  • Competitive compensation package depending on your experience.
  • 30 days of vacation per year – plus an extra day off on your birthday, just for you!
  • An exciting opportunity to join a well-funded and fast-growing German e-commerce start-up, where you can help build and shape the company from the ground up!
  • Fast-moving, ambitious & entrepreneurial culture, strong career development, and growth opportunities.
  • We’re dog-friendly! Bring your dog along to work.


Sounds exciting?

Apply now! We can’t wait to get to know you!

At BARFERs we value a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we believe it is the key to innovation and happy employees. BARFERs is committed to providing an open, friendly, safe, and welcoming environment for every employee. We are delighted to receive applications from diverse candidates including gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, and religious beliefs

BARFERs does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our job’s alias, BARFERs employees or any other organization location. BARFERs will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Title: Data Analyst - Geospatial Data
Description:
Looking for an opportunity to work with large-scale geospatial data in a dynamic and innovative environment? Passionate about turning raw data into actionable insights and collaborating with cross-functional teams?




We're recruiting a Data Analyst on behalf of our clients in Berlin, a forward thinking tech startup. This is a great opportunity to join their team and contribute to building a scalable, high-performing platform that serves billions of requests. This role focuses on statistical analysis, KPI reporting, and supporting data-driven decision-making to enhance product performance.




Key responsibilities:

Own and streamline KPI reporting processes to track system performance and quality metrics.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to identify and drive optimizations.
Analyze complex data streams to answer key stakeholder questions and provide actionable insights.
Build dashboards and visualizations to communicate findings effectively.
Contribute to data exploration and migration initiatives, supporting infrastructure improvements.




Key skills:

Solid experience with SQL and your preferred data tools or languages (e.g., Python, Java, Node.js).
Strong expertise in KPI reporting and visualization tools, such as AWS Quicksight or alternatives
Ability to derive insights from unstructured data and present findings to diverse audiences.
Collaborative mindset with experience working across engineering, product, and business teams.
Proactive and self-driven problem-solving approach with excellent communication skills in English.




Bonus points for:

Experience analyzing geospatial data or data quality metrics.




Interested, or know someone who would be? Click Apply or get in touch directly on iroghina@trg-uk.com

Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
GEMEINSAM ERFOLGREICH

Sie suchen eine neue Herausforderung? Sie möchten Ihre Karriere in eine neue Richtung lenken? Sie möchten etwas bewegen?

Unser Data Intelligence & Digital Enablement Team in Deutschland schafft durch den Einsatz von Daten, Technologien und innovativen Lösungen echten Mehrwert für unser Business. Wir treiben die digitale Transformation des Unternehmens voran, managen zentrale Enterprise Applikationen und unterstützen unsere operativen Business- und Research-Teams bei der Erweiterung, Pflege, Konsolidierung, Analyse und Visualisierung einer einzigartigen Immobiliendatenlandschaft.

Für unser Team suchen wir ab sofort einen Data Analyst (m/w/d) in Berlin, Hamburg oder Frankfurt am Main.

Als Data Analyst (m/w/d) steuern Sie zentrale Datenprojekte für CBRE-Standorte in Deutschland, entwickeln unsere cloud-basierte Datenplattform weiter und automatisieren Prozesse, um datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu ermöglichen.

IMMOBILIEN – WIR MACHEN DAS

CBRE ist – in Bezug auf den Umsatz im Geschäftsjahr 2023 – der größte globale Immobiliendienstleister. Mit mehr als 130.000 Mitarbeitern in über 100 Ländern steht CBRE Investoren und Immobiliennutzern als Partner für alle Immobilienbelange weltweit zur Seite. Wir bieten unseren Kunden ein breites Spektrum an integrierten Leistungen aus einer Hand – über den gesamten Lebenszyklus einer Immobilie hinweg.

DAS MACHEN SIE BEI UNS


(Weiter-)Entwicklung und Verwaltung zentraler Business Intelligence (BI) Produkte für den Geschäftsbereich Property Management (PM) in enger Abstimmung mit den relevanten internen Stakeholdern
Bearbeitung von hoch priorisierten neuen Anwendungsfällen aus dem Anforderungskatalog der PM-Plattform mithilfe von Datenbankabfragen und BI Tools in enger Abstimmung mit dem Data Engineering Team
Überprüfung und gegebenenfalls Neuentwicklung existierender PM-Datenmanagement-Prozesse
Dokumentation bestehender und zukünftiger datenbezogener Anwendungsfälle von PM
Erstellung eines Datenkatalogs inklusive Data Lineage und Business Glossary
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Continental Europe Data Teams zur Anpassung regionaler Tools an den lokalen Kontext
Eigenständige, proaktive Weiterbildung und Recherche in PM-relevanten Themen mithilfe von internen und externen Ressourcen


DAS HABEN SIE ZU BIETEN


Master-Abschluss (Universität/FH) in Wirtschaftsinformatik, Geoinformatik, Wirtschaftsmathematik, quantitativ-orientierter Geographie oder vergleichbaren Studiengängen
Fachkenntnisse und/oder Praxiserfahrung in der Immobilienwirtschaft, idealerweise mit Fokus Property Management
Idealerweise 1-2 Jahre relevante Berufserfahrung in fortgeschrittener Datenanalyse auf Datenbankebene (PostgreSQL & Snowflake), Datenqualitätsmanagement, Datenvisualisierung und Projektmanagement
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in der Datenbanksprache SQL sowie im Umgang mit BI-Tools (z.B. Tableau, Alteryx) sind zwingend erforderlich
Grundkenntnisse in Programmiersprachen wie Python oder R sind von Vorteil
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in MS Office365 (Excel, Powerpoint, Teams, Planner, OneNote)
Kenntnisse in Datenvisualisierung und Graphikdesign sind von Vorteil
Hervorragende schriftliche und verbale Kommunikationsfähigkeit auf Deutsch und Englisch; sehr gute organisatorische und analytische Fähigkeiten; sorgfältige, proaktive und verlässliche Arbeitsweise; gute Präsentationsfähigkeit
Kundenorientierte, enthusiastische, hands-on, problemlösungs- und innovationsorientierte Grundeinstellung


DAS BIETEN WIR IHNEN


Wir machen flexibles und mobiles Arbeiten möglich: Egal ob im Büro, zu Hause, unterwegs oder während einer Workation
Werden Sie Teil des einzigartigen CBRE-Spirits und profitieren Sie von schnellen Entscheidungswegen und Duz-Kultur
Bleiben Sie mobil mit unserem Fahrtkostenzuschuss zum ÖPNV
Durch das offene high-end Bürokonzept leben wir täglich unsere Unternehmenskultur auf Augenhöhe
Erfolge zusammen feiern! Dafür gibt es Gelegenheit bei regelmäßigen Team-Events
Profitieren Sie von weiteren Benefits wie Familienservice, Corporate Benefits, Betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Sonderkonditionen für Fitnessstudios, JobRad u.v.m


MACHEN SIE MIT?

Werden Sie Teil unserer Erfolgsgeschichte! - Wir freuen uns über Ihre Bewerbung als Data Analyst (m/w/d) über unser Online-Bewerbungssystem, inklusive Lebenslauf, Anschreiben und relevanten Zeugnissen.

Bitte beachten Sie, dass wir aus Datenschutzgründen leider keine Bewerbungen per E-Mail annehmen können.

Bei Rückfragen zur Stellenanzeige wenden Sie sich gerne per E-Mail an unser Talent Acquisition Team: bewerbung@cbre.com


Show more

  • Profitieren Sie von weiteren Benefits wie Familienservice, Corporate Benefits, Betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Sonderkonditionen für Fitnessstudios, JobRad u.v.m

Bitte beachten Sie, dass wir aus Datenschutzgründen leider keine Bewerbungen per E-Mail annehmen können.

Bei Rückfragen zur Stellenanzeige wenden Sie sich gerne per E-Mail an unser Talent Acquisition Team: bewerbung@cbre.com

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
As a Marketing BI Analyst (m/f/d) in the Global Digital Marketing & Sales Operations Team, you will be primarily responsible for generating and preparing data-driven insights for our marketing, service, and sales activities. By aggregating, analyzing, and visualizing data from various sources, you will play a key role in optimizing our customer journey, enhancing the efficiency of our marketing and lead generation campaigns, improving call center management processes, and supporting strategic decision-making.

Your impact


Conducting customer journey analyses using Global Digital Marketing data to identify trends and derive actionable recommendations.
Developing, maintaining, and optimizing dashboards and reports in Power BI and Google Sheets for KPI visualization and monitoring.
Automating and optimizing data processes while ensuring data quality using Python, SQL, and Databricks.
Supporting central and global marketing teams with planning, forecasting, and ongoing monitoring of their target KPIs.
Creating country-specific analyses to drive growth and optimize the use of digital marketing channels in individual markets.
Collaborating closely with the Data Engineering and Data Science teams within Viessmann IT.
Preparing results in the form of presentations, reports, and summaries for relevant stakeholders.


Who You Are


A completed degree in business administration, economics, data science, or a comparable analytical field.
Several years of professional experience in business intelligence, data analytics, CRM, or a similar analytical area.
Strong analytical skills and knowledge of statistics and data modeling.
Extensive experience with tools like Power BI, Google Data Studio, Databricks, and ideally Python, SQL, or similar technologies.
Experience in analyzing CRM, call center, and/or performance marketing data.
Ability to effectively prepare and present complex data in an understandable and impactful way.
Independent, structured working style and enjoyment of working in an international, cross-functional team.
Language skills in German and English (at least Level B2).


Even if you don't fulfill all of the above but are ready to take this challenge on as a next step, go ahead and press “Apply” anyway. We love your spirit!

What Makes Us Special

Our employees are the key to make our vision come alive. With that in mind, we‘ve created a range of perks for our employees:


A permanent position awaits you at our business where new technologies meet a modern workplace culture.
Viessmann Climate Solutions offers 30 days of paid vacation a year.
Once you join Viessmann, you can refer other great candidates and receive a referral bonus if they are hired.
Enjoy cool exclusive discounts on selected Viessmann Climate Solutions products and services.
Need a quick energy boost? Free healthy snacks and drinks are provided for you.
For a healthier community: Our health program offers easy access to coaching and therapy for our employees and their families.
Whether commuting by Job Bike or travelling by Europcar - our partnerships will protect the environment and your wallet.
The Viessmann academy and external partners offer a wide range of professional and personal training opportunities.
Whenever possible, Viessmann offers the option of mobile working and also provides the needed technical equipment.
Celebrate and have a great time with your co-workers at our individualized events, like our monthly breakfast or other team events.
Our flexible working hours allow you to balance your work and private life.
Daycare center or school closed? No problem! Your child will find toys and enough space to play-- and you have a fully equipped workplace to work in our child-parent room.


Who We Are

We are Viessmann Climate Solutions. Founded in 1917 as a heating technology manufacturer, and now part of Carrier, we are today one of the world's leading providers of efficient and systemic climate and renewable energy solutions. We cover all applications: heating, cooling, ventilation, water and air quality, energy generation, and energy storage for the residential and commercial sector.

Our integrated solution offering seamlessly connects products and systems via digital platforms and services to a holistic climate and energy solution, thus creating a safe and reliable feel-good climate for our users. All activities are driven by our company purpose, "We create living spaces for generations to come" and our employees are passionate about playing an active role in the energy transition. Join us on this exciting journey now.
Show more

Title: BI Analyst (all genders)
Description:
We drive decisions in Zalando’s Logistics and Customer Care divisions and are looking for a BI Analyst (all genders) to translate complex business requests into data products. You will help our stakeholders by creating reports, automating data, and implementing new KPIs. Furthermore, you will contribute to data projects by providing solution designs and data consulting. You will be part of a very supportive 20-person BI team with high seniority.


INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN


At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups


WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)




You gather business requirements, analyse them, connect the dots using data, and drive the implementation. You also perform data source analyses to understand our processes and provide curated data across platforms to our stakeholders.
You solve ad-hoc KPI requests and create reports in MicroStrategy
You help extend and optimise our data model.
You use Redshift, PostgreSQL, Airflow, and Databricks.
You provide meaningful insights across different levels of audiences and communicate effectively, translating complex topics into manageable, simple, plain language.
You collaborate with our engineers and project managers to create and implement new self-service reporting initiatives in an agile environment. You also build a strong, trust-based network with stakeholders, peers, and others.
You get a tailored BI Analytics development plan and training to foster growth.




WE’D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF




You obtained an academic degree in Information Systems, Analytics, Economics, Computer Science, Statistics, or other similar quantitative fields.
You have experience in working with big piles of data.
You are a quick learner, analytical, solution-driven, pragmatic, and stakeholder-focused.
You are passionate about reading and writing complex statements and modelling data structures on relational databases.
You challenge the status quo, drive innovation, and are keen to identify and apply best practices.
Fluent in English is a must. Experience in Logistics or Customer Care is a plus.




OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model, with flexible hours and up to 60% remote
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available
Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review




ABOUT ZALANDO


It’s the perfect time to join Zalando’s journey, from being a pioneer in the world of e-commerce, to becoming the Starting Point for Fashion in Europe. We connect customers, brands, and partners across 25 markets.

Help us drive digital and sustainable solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 49 million active customers.

Our values https //jobs.zalando.com/en/our-founding-mindset

do.More - our sustainability strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/domore-our-sustainability-strategy

Follow us on Instagram instagram.com/insidezalando

Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

Title: Data Analyst - Online Payments
Description:
About The Team

We are seeking a Data Analyst to strengthen the Online Payments tribe. The OP tribe is driven by a bold vision: to transform the way businesses and customers experience payments. We're not just creating transactions; we're empowering merchants to thrive and delivering seamless, secure payment experiences that leave customers delighted. Every interaction, across all SumUp products and beyond, is crafted to be frictionless, intuitive, and reliable.

What you'll do:


You'll be responsible for product analytics for the OP tribe.
You will create and maintain the tribe’s dashboards, monitoring KPI trends over time, and highlighting noteworthy changes to the relevant squads.
You’ll work on ad-hoc analysis to answer important product questions.
You’ll develop and lead a/b testing for new product features, providing the squads with recommendations based on the data.
You will monitor product and payment platform performance and provide PMs with updates and strategic recommendations.
You will collaborate closely with our data engineer to ensure that data is properly collected, stored, processed, and accessible for Online Payments business needs
You will build new models in dbt to be used for tribe analytics and reports
You’ll own the product analytics road map for the team, and drive strategic data OKRs aligned with SumUp's business goals


You'll be an excellent fit for this role if you possess:


Over 3 years of professional work experience in data analytics and in data model design, with experience in dbt and SQL, and collaborative development using Git
Hands-on experience in developing advanced dashboards following industry best practices, preferably in Tableau or Superset
Basic understanding of statistics, such as regression, classification, and clustering
Demonstrable experience setting up, monitoring, and managing A-B testing and experimentation processes.
Experience in the finance industry, with the capacity to examine Finance requirements across various functional areas and translate them into KPIs, insights, data models and dashboards
Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills, coupled with effective communication skills and a strategic mindset, enabling seamless collaboration with OP leadership


Why you should join SumUp:

🌍 Opportunity to work with SumUppers globally from the Berlin office. This involves an office-first setup.

📚 A dedicated annual L&D budget for attending conferences and/or advancing your career through further education

🚀 Enrolment onto our VSOP program - you will own a stake in SumUp’s future success.

👩🏼‍💻 The opportunity to work on large scale fintech products used by millions of businesses around the world

💶 A corporate pension scheme where we match up to 20% of your contributions

🚵🏾‍♂️ Numerous other benefits such as Urban Sports Club subsidy, Kita placement assistance, relocation assistance, subsidized office lunches.

SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. SumUp does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by Company policy. SumUp also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.

About us:

SumUp is a leading financial technology company, founded in 2012 with the goal of empowering small businesses around the globe. We’re the financial partner of choice for more than 4 million merchants in over 35 markets. We collectively build, plan and fine-tune the technology that drives SumUp and empowers small businesses around the world.

We believe in the everyday hero. Those who have the courage to follow their passion and who have the strength and determination to realise their dreams. Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we're creating powerful, easy-to-use financial solutions to help them run their business. With a founders mentality and a 'team-first attitude' our diverse teams across Europe, South America, and the United States work together to ensure that small business owners can be successful doing what they love.

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don’t tick every box, it’s ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.

Title: Senior Data & Analytics Specialist (w/m/d)
Description:
Company Description

At Enpal, we are pursuing the dream of building the largest renewable community in Europe. How do we make that happen? Enpal finally simplifies providing solar energy: We rent out solar systems, electricity storage, and wall boxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a favorable green electricity tariff; all intelligently connected to form an integrated overall solution. True to the motto "digital, decentralized, and 100% renewable", our heart beats both for the rapid development of a company and for combating the greatest challenge of our generation - climate change.

Job Description


Work closely with the Heat Pump division stakeholders to design, build, and maintain automated data pipelines and ensure the best-in-class reporting infrastructure.
Implement and maintain automated Reporting for different business units to provide visibility and performance tracking across segments.
Develop deep knowledge of customer journey processes and use it to empower the business stakeholders to optimize the conversion funnel and achieve operational excellence.



Qualifications


5+ years of relevant experience in business intelligence, data analytics or similar roles.
Enthusiasm for working in dynamic, rapidly changing environments.
Strong ability to analyse data, identify patterns, and communicate. technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proven track record in automating data pipelines.
Exposure to Python for data analysis (e.g. pandas).
Our BI stack includes Snowflake, Streamlit, Tableau and dbt. Familiarity with the two latter ones is required/desired.
High proficiency in SQL and ETL processes.



Additional Information


The chance to be part of a fast-growing and future-oriented startup: we are one of the biggest players in the solar business.
A hybrid work model, the ability to come to our Berlin office every now and then for in person discussions and events, or to be there all the time - you decide.
Work with the best in the industry and grow with us: there’s plenty of room for your ideas.
Help to make the world a bit better: we are all about green energy.



At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. We strongly encourage women, neurodivergent people, people of color, and LGBTQ(+) people to apply. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Berlin - Berlin - Germany, Frankfurt am Main - Hessen - Germany, Hamburg - Hamburg - Germany

GEMEINSAM ERFOLGREICH


Sie suchen eine neue Herausforderung? Sie möchten Ihre Karriere in eine neue Richtung lenken? Sie möchten etwas bewegen?

UnserData Intelligence & Digital Enablement Teamin Deutschland schafft durch den Einsatz von Daten, Technologien und innovativen Lösungen echten Mehrwert für unser Business. Wir treiben die digitale Transformation des Unternehmens voran, managen zentrale Enterprise Applikationen und unterstützen unsere operativen Business- und Research-Teams bei der Erweiterung, Pflege, Konsolidierung, Analyse und Visualisierung einer einzigartigen Immobiliendatenlandschaft.

Für unser Team suchen wir ab sofort einenData Analyst (m/w/d)inBerlin, HamburgoderFrankfurt am Main.


AlsData Analyst (m/w/d)steuern Sie zentrale Datenprojekte für CBRE-Standorte in Deutschland, entwickeln unsere cloud-basierte Datenplattform weiter und automatisieren Prozesse, um datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu ermöglichen.

IMMOBILIEN – WIR MACHEN DAS


CBRE ist – in Bezug auf den Umsatz im Geschäftsjahr 2023 – der größte globale Immobiliendienstleister. Mit mehr als 130.000 Mitarbeitern in über 100 Ländern steht CBRE Investoren und Immobiliennutzern als Partner für alle Immobilienbelange weltweit zur Seite. Wir bieten unseren Kunden ein breites Spektrum an integrierten Leistungen aus einer Hand – über den gesamten Lebenszyklus einer Immobilie hinweg.

DAS MACHEN SIE BEI UNS



(Weiter-)Entwicklung und Verwaltung zentraler Business Intelligence (BI) Produkte für den Geschäftsbereich Property Management (PM) in enger Abstimmung mit den relevanten internen Stakeholdern
Bearbeitung von hoch priorisierten neuen Anwendungsfällen aus dem Anforderungskatalog der PM-Plattform mithilfe von Datenbankabfragen und BI Tools in enger Abstimmung mit dem Data Engineering Team
Überprüfung und gegebenenfalls Neuentwicklung existierender PM-Datenmanagement-Prozesse
Dokumentation bestehender und zukünftiger datenbezogener Anwendungsfälle von PM
Erstellung eines Datenkatalogs inklusive Data Lineage und Business Glossary
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Continental Europe Data Teams zur Anpassung regionaler Tools an den lokalen Kontext
Eigenständige, proaktive Weiterbildung und Recherche in PM-relevanten Themen mithilfe von internen und externen Ressourcen


DAS HABEN SIE ZU BIETEN



Master-Abschluss (Universität/FH) in Wirtschaftsinformatik, Geoinformatik, Wirtschaftsmathematik, quantitativ-orientierter Geographie oder vergleichbaren Studiengängen
Fachkenntnisse und/oder Praxiserfahrung in der Immobilienwirtschaft, idealerweise mit Fokus Property Management
Idealerweise 1-2 Jahre relevante Berufserfahrung in fortgeschrittener Datenanalyse auf Datenbankebene (PostgreSQL & Snowflake), Datenqualitätsmanagement, Datenvisualisierung und Projektmanagement
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in der Datenbanksprache SQL sowie im Umgang mit BI-Tools (z.B. Tableau, Alteryx) sind zwingend erforderlich
Grundkenntnisse in Programmiersprachen wie Python oder R sind von Vorteil
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in MS Office365 (Excel, Powerpoint, Teams, Planner, OneNote)
Kenntnisse in Datenvisualisierung und Graphikdesign sind von Vorteil
Hervorragende schriftliche und verbale Kommunikationsfähigkeit auf Deutsch und Englisch; sehr gute organisatorische und analytische Fähigkeiten; sorgfältige, proaktive und verlässliche Arbeitsweise; gute Präsentationsfähigkeit
Kundenorientierte, enthusiastische, hands-on, problemlösungs- und innovationsorientierte Grundeinstellung


DAS BIETEN WIR IHNEN



Wir machen flexibles und mobiles Arbeiten möglich: Egal ob im Büro, zu Hause, unterwegs oder während einer Workation
Werden Sie Teil des einzigartigen CBRE-Spirits und profitieren Sie von schnellen Entscheidungswegen und Duz-Kultur
Bleiben Sie mobil mit unserem Fahrtkostenzuschuss zum ÖPNV
Durch das offene high-end Bürokonzept leben wir täglich unsere Unternehmenskultur auf Augenhöhe
Erfolge zusammen feiern! Dafür gibt es Gelegenheit bei regelmäßigen Team-Events
Profitieren Sie von weiteren Benefits wie Familienservice, Corporate Benefits, Betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Sonderkonditionen für Fitnessstudios, JobRad u.v.m


MACHEN SIE MIT?


Werden Sie Teil unserer Erfolgsgeschichte! - Wir freuen uns über Ihre Bewerbung als Data Analyst (m/w/d) über unser Online-Bewerbungssystem, inklusive Lebenslauf, Anschreiben und relevanten Zeugnissen.

Bitte beachten Sie, dass wir aus Datenschutzgründen leider keine Bewerbungen per E-Mail annehmen können.

Bei Rückfragen zur Stellenanzeige wenden Sie sich gerne per E-Mail an unser Talent Acquisition Team: bewerbung@cbre.com

Service line: None
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Founded in 2008, BMG has become the fourth-largest music company worldwide. Our success and competitive edge are rooted in our founding values of fairness, transparency, and service. Our mission is clear: to empower artists and songwriters to maximize the potential of their songs and recordings in the digital era.

BMG’s Global Data Analytics is our central data unit, spanning a close-knit international team of experienced Analytics Engineers, Data Analysts and Data Scientists across Germany, the US and the UK. We’re transforming how music works, enabling operational stakeholders to make data-driven decisions as well as driving strategic growth, based on a modern data stack.

 

We are currently seeking a motivated Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join our headquarters in Berlin. This position is a maternity cover, initially expected to last until end of April 2026. As an experienced Data Analyst, you will collaborate with senior stakeholders of various departments to facilitate informed decision-making through novel data insights, compelling storytelling, and advanced data visualization. Join us in shaping the future of music analytics!

 

What You’ll Be Doing


Process big data volumes, modelling and transforming data (using dbt) from centralized DWHs (Google BigQuery) and external/organizational databases to build strategic analyses and operational KPIs
Utilize data visualization to support decision-making, crafting compelling (Looker) dashboards for key business stakeholders (e.g. Investments, Artist & Repertoire, Marketing, Streaming Sales, Rights & Royalties, Operations)
Develop scalable self-service reporting solutions and address diverse ad-hoc requests that transform our business
Collaborate closely with our global team and international colleagues to foster a data-driven culture by proposing innovative initiatives and building actionable data products


What You Bring


Degree in Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
Profound experience in data analytics, ideally with large datasets
Excellent SQL skills and good knowledge of Python
Proficiency in data visualization tools, such as Looker or Tableau
Broad understanding of data analysis methods and storytelling
Results-driven and analytical character, with a strategic mindset to derive business insights
Effective communication skills - confident in presenting findings to senior management
Ability to build relationships with stakeholders to understand business needs and data consumer needs
Capability to plan and implement projects independently
Comfortable working in a global, fast-paced and dynamic environment


It’s also a plus if you have…


Prior music industry experience
Experience with GCP, dbt and Git/Bitbucket
Knowledge of Jira and Confluence
Understanding of statistical methods and ML


What We Offer


A modern office in the heart of Berlin and flexible options for remote work
Numerous benefits such as a free BVG job ticket, a reduced-price membership for Urban Sports, company bike leasing, discounts for Bertelsmann employees, among others
Ongoing training opportunities on our internal platforms BMG Campus and Bertelsmann University
Long-term career opportunities for all employees
A collaborative work environment with an open, appreciative community of people who all share the same passion for working with artists and songwriters
Our unique corporate culture based on strong values and mutual support that make us a great team


This is us

As the great Kurt Cobain once said, "Come as you are." BMG is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all employees. We value diversity in all forms. Equal opportunity is deeply rooted in our core value of fairness, and we are committed to creating a truly inclusive work environment where everyone can thrive. If you're good at what you do, come as you are! Whether you're an experienced professional or just starting out, we welcome you to join our team.

All applicants to BMG are treated equally - regardless of age, disability, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy or parenthood, ethnic origin, color, nationality, religion or belief.

(BMG is publishing Kurt Cobain's catalog, including the 1992 single 'Come As You Are.')

  • Our unique corporate culture based on strong values and mutual support that make us a great team

This is us

As the great Kurt Cobain once said, "Come as you are." BMG is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all employees. We value diversity in all forms. Equal opportunity is deeply rooted in our core value of fairness, and we are committed to creating a truly inclusive work environment where everyone can thrive. If you're good at what you do, come as you are! Whether you're an experienced professional or just starting out, we welcome you to join our team.

All applicants to BMG are treated equally - regardless of age, disability, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy or parenthood, ethnic origin, color, nationality, religion or belief.

(BMG is publishing Kurt Cobain's catalog, including the 1992 single 'Come As You Are.')

Unternehmen: BMG RIGHTS MANAGEMENT GmbH - Corporate

Land: Germany

Region: Berlin

Stadt: Berlin

Postleitzahl: 10117

Job ID: 276646

Date: 9 Jan 2025

Location:

Berlin, BE, DE, 10117

Job Segment: Database, Data Analyst, Computer Science, SQL, Technology, Data

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Department: Product

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote/Berlin

Description

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn and save by reshaping their relationship with money. Over 5,000,000 active users choose Tabby to stay in control of their spending and make the most out of their money.

Over 30,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, H&M, Adidas, IKEA, SHEIN, noon, and Bloomingdale’s use Tabby’s technology to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering flexible payments online and in stores. Tabby is active in Saudi Arabia, UAE, Egypt and Kuwait and backed by leading investors, including Sequoia Capital India, STV, PayPal Ventures, Mubadala Investment Capital, Arbor Ventures and others.

We are looking for a Marketing Analyst to contribute to the evolution of Tabby. Marketing Analyst will work with our marketing team and help us evaluate marketing efficiency and find the best way to acquire new and reactivate existing users, playing a pivotal role in launching and optimizing marketing strategies that drive meaningful impact. You'll collaborate closely with Analysts, Marketing, and Product teams.

You’ll be working in a dynamic, rapidly evolving environment with the following responsibilities:


Provide analytical support to the Marketing and Product Marketing teams across all facets of their work, including evaluation of customer. acquisition cost, customer spending forecast, and finding an optimal mix of marketing channels.
Generate hypotheses, conduct research and A/B tests, and present your findings clearly and compellingly to highlight the importance of your insights.
Support and monitor existing performance marketing metrics, identify areas for improvement, and develop new metrics that inform decision-making across the organization.
Develop data visualizations and reports that are informative and easily understood by business and product teams.
Assist in the planning of necessary data structures.



Skills, Knowledge & Expertise:


3+ years of experience as a data/marketing analyst.
Proficiency in SQL and relational databases.
Proficiency in data visualization tools, particularly Tableau.
Proficiency in digital marketing platforms from Meta and Google.
Strong understanding of mobile attribution and MMPs (AppsFlyer, Adjust, etc.), including event tracking, postbacks, and troubleshooting.
Experience working with SKAdNetwork (SKAN) data — extracting, decoding, and analyzing postbacks to optimize iOS campaigns.
Knowledge of privacy-first attribution frameworks like Apple’s ATT, Meta's AEM, and Google’s Privacy Sandbox.
Experience with marketing attribution platforms is a plus.
Knowledge of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Statsmodels, Matplotlib, etc.) is a plus.
Experience in designing and conducting A/B tests is a plus.
Strong quantitative skills and a structured approach to problem-solving. Ability to analyze issues, identify root causes, and recommend solutions.
Fluency in English.



Job Benefits:


We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
Participation in company’s employee stock options program.
Health Insurance.



Relocation

We offer remote work from anywhere in the world and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.

Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration: at the moment those are Armenia/Georgia/Serbia/Portugal/Spain.

We will help you open a legal entity and a bank account. In Armenia and Georgia the taxes are compensated by Tabby. In other countries we provide partial compensation of taxes.

We employ according to B2B contracts (service agreements).

For our employees we cover the following:


Flight to one of the mentioned countries.
Accommodation during the paperwork completion period.
Opening a bank account and getting a residence permit in one of the mentioned countries.
Family relocation (dependants).



New employees can also choose an alternative method of relocation to another country of their choice. In this case, Tabby will reimburse up to $5,000 of verified costs upon opening a legal entity and a bank account.

We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow and meet their goals (whatever they may be).

If this sounds exciting to you, we’d love to hear from you!
Show more

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Als Marketing BI Analyst (m/w/d) im Global Digital Marketing & Sales Operations Team bist du maßgeblich dafür verantwortlich, datengetriebene Insights für unsere Marketing-, Service- und Vertriebsaktivitäten zu generieren und aufzubereiten. Durch die Aggregation, Analyse und Visualisierung von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen trägst du entscheidend zur Optimierung unserer Customer Journey, der Effizienz unserer Marketing- und Lead-Generierungskampagnen, der Call Center Management Prozesse und der strategischen Entscheidungsfindung bei.

Was du bewirkst


Durchführung von Analysen der Customer Journey anhand der Global Digital Marketing Daten, um Trends zu identifizieren und Handlungsempfehlungen abzuleiten
Entwicklung, Pflege und Optimierung von Dashboards und Reportings in Power BI und Google Sheets zur Visualisierung und Überwachung von KPIs
Automatisierung und Optimierung von Datenprozessen und Sicherstellung der Datenqualität durch den Einsatz von Python, SQL und Databricks
Unterstützung des zentralen sowie globalen Marketings bei der Planung, dem Forecasting und dem unterjährigen Monitoring ihrer Ziel-KPIs
Erstellung länderspezifischer Analysen, um Wachstum zu generieren und die Nutzung der digitalen Marketingkanäle in den einzelnen Märkten zu optimieren
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Data Engineering und Data Science Teams innerhalb der Viessmann IT
Aufbereitung von Ergebnissen in Form von Präsentationen, Reports und Zusammenfassungen für relevante Stakeholder


Das bist du


Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Wirtschaftswissenschaften, BWL, Data Science oder einem vergleichbaren analytischen Bereich
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in den Bereichen Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, CRM oder in einem vergleichbaren analytischen Bereich
Sehr gute analytische Fähigkeiten sowie Kenntnisse in Statistik und Data Modeling
Fundierte Erfahrung mit Tools wie Power BI, Google Data Studio, Databricks und idealerweise auch mit Python, SQL oder ähnlichen Technologien
Erfahrung bei der Analyse von CRM, Call Center und/oder Performance Marketing Daten
Fähigkeit, komplexe Daten verständlich und wirkungsvoll aufzubereiten und zu präsentieren
Selbstständige, strukturierte Arbeitsweise und Freude an der Arbeit in einem internationalen, cross-funktionalen Team
Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch (mind. Level B2)


Auch wenn du nicht alle Punkte erfüllst, aber bereit für die Herausforderung bist, dann klicke trotzdem auf "Bewerben". Wir lieben deinen Spirit!

Das macht uns besonders

Unsere Mitarbeiter:innen sind der Schlüssel dazu, unsere Vision zum Leben zu erwecken. Basierend auf dieser Überzeugung haben wir Benefits für unsere Mitarbeiter:innen geschaffen:


Dich erwartet eine Festanstellung in einem erfolgreichen Unternehmen, in dem neue Technologien auf eine moderne Arbeitsplatzkultur treffen.
Bei Viessmann Climate Solutions bekommst du 30 Tage bezahlten Urlaub im Jahr.
Du hast als Mitarbeiter:in erfolgreich eine neue Kollegin oder einen Kollegen geworben? Als Dankeschön bekommst du eine Empfehlungsprämie.
Genieße unsere großartigen Exklusiv-Rabatte auf ausgewählte Viessmann Climate Solutions Produkte und Dienstleistungen.
Kleiner Energiekick zwischendurch gefällig? Bei uns stehen kostenlose gesunde Snacks und Getränke für dich bereit.
Für ein gesundes Miteinander: Unser Gesundheitsprogramm bietet einfachen Zugang zu Coachings und Therapie für unsere Mitarbeitenden und deren Familien.
Ob mit Job Bike oder mit Europcar – unsere Partnerschaften schonen gleichzeitig die Umwelt und deinen Geldbeutel.
Unsere Viessmann Akademie und externen Partner bieten zahlreiche fachliche und persönliche Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten an.
Viessmann bietet dir, wann immer möglich, die Option zum mobilen Arbeiten und sorgt für die passende technische Ausstattung.
Bei uns kommt der Spaß nicht zu kurz, denn bei Viessmann freuen wir uns auf gemeinsame Events, wie unser monatliches Frühstück oder andere Teamevents.
Unsere flexiblen Arbeitszeiten ermöglichen es dir, Arbeit und Privatleben miteinander zu vereinbaren.
Kita oder Schule zu? Kein Problem! In unserem Eltern-Kind-Raum hat dein Nachwuchs ausreichend Platz und Spielzeuge und du hast einen voll ausgestatteten Arbeitsplatz.


Das sind wir

Wir sind Viessmann Climate Solutions. 1917 als Heiztechnik-Hersteller gegründet, sind wir heute, als Teil von Carrier, ein weltweit führender Anbieter für effiziente und systemische Klima- und erneuerbare Energielösungen für den Wohn- und Gewerbesektor. Wir decken alle Anwendungen ab: Heizen, Kühlen, Lüften, Wasser- und Luftqualität, Energieerzeugung und Energiespeicherung für den Wohn- und Gebäudesektor.

Unser integriertes Lösungsangebot verbindet Produkte und Systeme über digitale Plattformen und Dienstleistungen nahtlos zu einer ganzheitlichen Klima- und Energielösung und schafft so ein sicheres und verlässliches Wohlfühlklima für unsere Nutzer:innen. Alle Aktivitäten basieren auf unserem Unternehmensleitbild „Wir gestalten Lebensräume für zukünftige Generationen‟ und unsere Mitarbeiter:innen spielen dabei mit Leidenschaft eine aktive Rolle bei der Energiewende. Sei ein Teil von dieser spannenden Reise.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Lounge by Zalando (all genders)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM


As a Data Analyst for the Markets Analytics team in the Markets & Sales department, you will help build the next generation assortment-offering engine for Lounge by Zalando, while putting data at the core of our decisions and processes. Developing a deep understanding of our customers, evaluating our business decisions through complex analyses and deriving actionable insights as well as supporting the localised strategic directions will be part of your mission.


INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN


At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups


WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)




You apply your data expertise and scientific knowledge in causal methods to support business decision-making, understand our customers and evaluate impact. You focus on delivering value through actionable insights and support the business in making informed decisions.
You collaborate with tech teams and develop your work into user-friendly data products and reports, answering questions such as which stock should be offered when to which customers ? Based on your insights, you optimise and automate business processes via statistical methods, such as sales forecasts.
You are an excellent communicator - you excel at data storytelling and empower the team and your stakeholders through simple and effective visualisations.
You have an avid interest both in our business and in learning new methodologies, through which you contribute valuable ideas in team discussions.




WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF




You have a strong educational background in social sciences such as economics or in a quantitative field such as statistics, mathematics, engineering or its equivalent. Master’s degree or higher preferred.
You have at least 2+ years of working experience as an analyst in a relevant field, ideally within an e-commerce context.
You demonstrate solid knowledge of SQL and Python and have experience with Git. You have a good understanding of statistical and causal methods.
You have excellent verbal and written communication and stakeholder management skills with a curious, creative and self-starter mindset. You couple your passion for data with pragmatism to drive actions and impact.
Experience with business intelligence tools like Tableau is a plus.



If you have what it takes, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every requirement. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles!


OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
Two paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with up to 60% remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching are available
Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review



Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us

About Lounge By Zalando

Lounge by Zalando is an online shopping club for fashion and lifestyle products in 17 European countries. We offer our members daily, time-limited sale campaigns with discounts of up to 75% off the recommended retail price. However, Lounge by Zalando is so much more than discounts. Our strength lies in our focus on fashion from sought-after labels to niche brands, from famous international names to trendy luxury brands, we make sure to meet the fashion taste of all our customers, who are always on the hunt for the best products at the best prices. Working with our brand partners, we're pioneering innovative supply-chain and production processes and offer them an impactful and smart solution, creating a new way to shop for fashion - and a new way to sell it.

https //www.zalando-lounge.de

Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.
Show more

Title: Social Media Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
Daten über das Social Media Verhalten deiner Zielgruppe faszinieren dich? Du liebst es, aus einer großen, ungeordneten Menge an Zahlen, konkrete Schlüsse zu ziehen und dein gewonnenes Wissen für andere verständlich zu machen? Du bist außerdem detailverliebt und hast Lust neue Prozesse mitzugestalten?

Dann sucht unser Team Dich! Als Social Media Analyst (w/m/d).

Bewirb Dich! Auch wenn das Profil auf den ersten Blick nicht zu 100% passt.

Aufgaben


Auswertung und Analyse von Performance-Daten auf allen relevanten Social-Media-Kanälen
Nutzung von Analyse-Tools (Sprinklr, Google Analytics, Google Looker Studio etc.)
Ableiten und Präsentieren von relevanten Erkenntnissen und Empfehlungen
Optimierung/Automatisierung von Datenverarbeitung und Prozessen
Visuelle Datenaufbereitung & Dashboarding
Unterstützung von interdisziplinären Projektteams
Die Chance, mit einer der weltweit führenden Automobilmarken zu arbeiten



Qualifikation


Expertise im Bereich Social Media Analytics, zusätzliche Kenntnisse in Social-Media-Strategie und Advertising
Ein Gespür für Zahlen
Kompetenz im Umgang mit den aktuell relevanten Social-Media-Netzwerken
Fähigkeit zum Aufbau vertrauensvoller Kund:innenbeziehungen
Sicherer Umgang mit MS Office und eine unbändige Excel-Leidenschaft
Ausgezeichnete Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse
Interesse an der Automobilbranche ist von Vorteil



Benefits


Hybrides Arbeitszeitmodell mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten
Regelmäßige Teamevents
Bis zu vier Wochen im Jahr im EU-Ausland arbeiten
30 Urlaubstage für alle Mitarbeiter:innen
Unbefristeter Vertrag nach 6-monatiger Probezeit
Raum zur Entfaltung und zum eigenverantwortlichen Arbeiten in deiner neuen Rolle
Jährliches Weiterbildungsbudget mit individuellem Gestaltungsspielraum



Wer wir sind

Seit 2008 Kreativagentur und Unternehmensberatung mit über 200 sehr guten Leuten in Berlin-Kreuzberg.


Autonomie, Vertrauen und Gestaltungsspielraum sind unsere Vision der modernen Arbeitswelt von morgen.
Wir unterstützen uns gegenseitig und glauben an die kulturstiftende Wirkung von regelmäßigen Teamevents zur beruflichen und persönlichen Weiterentwicklung.
Diversity, Gleichberechtigung sowie eine gesunde Work-Life Balance gehören zu unseren wichtigsten Werten.
Unser transparenter Feedbackprozess trägt bei uns zu einer offenen und wertschätzenden Kommunikationskultur bei.
Wir wollen zu deinem Leben passen. Zur Unterstützung in jeder Lebensphase bieten wir den vollen Work-Life-Care-Service des Fürstenberg Instituts an.



Wir freuen uns über deine digitale Bewerbung unter Angabe deines optimalen Einstiegstermins.
Show more

  • Raum zur Entfaltung und zum eigenverantwortlichen Arbeiten in deiner neuen Rolle
  • Jährliches Weiterbildungsbudget mit individuellem Gestaltungsspielraum


Wer wir sind

Seit 2008 Kreativagentur und Unternehmensberatung mit über 200 sehr guten Leuten in Berlin-Kreuzberg.

  • Unser transparenter Feedbackprozess trägt bei uns zu einer offenen und wertschätzenden Kommunikationskultur bei.
  • Wir wollen zu deinem Leben passen. Zur Unterstützung in jeder Lebensphase bieten wir den vollen Work-Life-Care-Service des Fürstenberg Instituts an.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
Description

#You is a young and ambitious technology-enabled brand builder in the field of direct-to-consumer e-commerce. Founded by an experienced team with a track record of launching and scaling DTC brands, we set ourselves apart with state of the art technology & operations, best in class marketing, creative content and a strong community of loving customers.

Your tasks


Be a domain expert and owner of Marketing Analytics & Marketing Data
Create and maintain dashboards for various departments
Suggest and execute solutions that move the business forward
Define key KPIs to support effective decision-making
Support and develop self-service analytics
Conduct deep-dive analysis on complex topics to support key strategic projects, identify growth opportunities, and support key decision-making
Maintain, optimize, and expand existing business logic in DBT - following best practices already in place.
Proactively ensure data quality and compliance
Maintain close coordination with marketing teams (including Influencer Marketing, CRM, and Performance Marketing)
Drive impactful projects with various departments to increase their working efficiency


Your profile


You have 3+ years of experience in Analytics / Business Intelligence, ideally in Marketing Analytics
You have 1+ years of experience as an Analytics Engineer or work experience in transforming and modeling data with SQL.
You have a solid understanding of how marketing data is generated in the front end and through third-party services, and how it should be processed afterward
Your SQL skills are great and you have a basic understanding of Python
You have work experience with version control tools like GIT
Analytical mindset, high attention to detail, obsession with automation
Curiosity and skills to research and solve technical challenges
Talent to translate business problems into effective data solutions
Ability to see the bigger picture and prepare your analysis outputs to always address the business question posed
Excellent English communication skills
You possess strong interpersonal skills for general stakeholder management.
Bonus points for:
Working experience with spreadsheets and modern BI tools
Working experience with Snowflake (or another MPP database), dbt, prefect, airflow
Knowledge of Python or some other general-purpose programming language
Practical knowledge of DataOps concepts
Working experience with dashboarding tools like Metabase
You feel at home with Marketing terminology and have a deep understanding of the dependencies and dynamics of the most important Marketing KPIs

Benefits


Receive your own Macbook and an annual BVG ticket
Benefit from regular 360° feedbacks and development paths
Get the opportunity to work both from home and in our modern, new office in Berlin – with free drinks and snacks and everything else you need
Take part in our team events
Benefit from our company pension scheme
Choose your favorite vouchers (Spotify, UrbanSports, Blinkist, WeShare, Rewe and many more) from our partner 'Hrmony' for a certain amount every month
Receive a voucher worth €200 every 2 months to order your favourite products from us directly to your home
Get free access to mental health support via our cooperation partner OpenUp
Receive support when moving to Germany
Show more

Benefits

  • Benefit from our company pension scheme
  • Choose your favorite vouchers (Spotify, UrbanSports, Blinkist, WeShare, Rewe and many more) from our partner 'Hrmony' for a certain amount every month

  • Get free access to mental health support via our cooperation partner OpenUp
  • Receive support when moving to Germany

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Founded in 2008, BMG has become the fourth-largest music company worldwide. Our success and competitive edge are rooted in our founding values of fairness, transparency, and service. Our mission is clear: to empower artists and songwriters to maximize the potential of their songs and recordings in the digital era.




BMG’s Global Data Analytics is our central data unit, spanning a close-knit international team of experienced Analytics Engineers, Data Analysts and Data Scientists across Germany, the US and the UK. We’re transforming how music works, enabling operational stakeholders to make data-driven decisions as well as driving strategic growth, based on a modern data stack.




We are currently seeking a motivated Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join our headquarters in Berlin. This position is a maternity cover, initially expected to last until end of April 2026. As an experienced Data Analyst, you will collaborate with senior stakeholders of various departments to facilitate informed decision-making through novel data insights, compelling storytelling, and advanced data visualization. Join us in shaping the future of music analytics!




What you’ll be doing

Process big data volumes, modelling and transforming data (using dbt) from centralized DWHs (Google BigQuery) and external/organizational databases to build strategic analyses and operational KPIs
Utilize data visualization to support decision-making, crafting compelling (Looker) dashboards for key business stakeholders (e.g. Investments, Artist & Repertoire, Marketing, Streaming Sales, Rights & Royalties, Operations)
Develop scalable self-service reporting solutions and address diverse ad-hoc requests that transform our business
Collaborate closely with our global team and international colleagues to foster a data-driven culture by proposing innovative initiatives and building actionable data products




What you bring

Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
Profound experience in data analytics, ideally with large datasets
Excellent SQL skills and good knowledge of Python
Proficiency in data visualization tools, such as Looker or Tableau
Broad understanding of data analysis methods and storytelling
Results-driven and analytical character, with a strategic mindset to derive business insights
Effective communication skills - confident in presenting findings to senior management
Ability to build relationships with stakeholders to understand business needs and data consumer needs
Capability to plan and implement projects independently
Comfortable working in a global, fast-paced and dynamic environment




It’s also a plus if you have…

Prior music industry experience
Experience with GCP, dbt and Git/Bitbucket
Knowledge of Jira and Confluence
Understanding of statistical methods and ML




What we offer

A modern office in the heart of Berlin and flexible options for remote work
Numerous benefits such as a free BVG job ticket, a reduced-price membership for Urban Sports, company bike leasing, discounts for Bertelsmann employees, among others
Ongoing training opportunities on our internal platforms BMG Campus and Bertelsmann University
Long-term career opportunities for all employees
A collaborative work environment with an open, appreciative community of people who all share the same passion for working with artists and songwriters
Our unique corporate culture based on strong values and mutual support that make us a great team




This is us

As the great Kurt Cobain once said, "Come as you are." BMG is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all employees. We value diversity in all forms. Equal opportunity is deeply rooted in our core value of fairness, and we are committed to creating a truly inclusive work environment where everyone can thrive. If you're good at what you do, come as you are! Whether you're an experienced professional or just starting out, we welcome you to join our team.

All applicants to BMG are treated equally - regardless of age, disability, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy or parenthood, ethnic origin, color, nationality, religion or belief.

(BMG is publishing Kurt Cobain's catalog, including the 1992 single 'Come As You Are.')

Show more
